ConversationMessageDefinition.label: How do I reset my 2-Factor Authentication (2FA)

primitiveValues.formulaTemplate:
How to Reset Your Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)

  1. Go to the login page: https://portal.ndax.io/auth/login

  2. Log in with your username and password.

  3. Click the "Reset 2FA" button on the next screen.

  4. Enter your Ndax email address and click Continue.

  5. Check your email for a 6-digit code and enter it on the website, then click Verify.

  6. Complete the identity verification through our partner, Sumsub:

    • Follow the prompts.
    • Record a short video pronouncing the digits or phrase shown on screen.
    • Upload the video when you're done.

  7. Once submitted, you'll see a message that your data is being reviewed.

You can now close the window.

  1. When your reset request is approved, you'll receive an email titled "Two-Factor Authentication Reset."

    • Click the "Reset Two-Factor Authentication" button in the email.
    • This link expires in 24 hours. If it expires, you'll need to start the process again.

  2. On the page you're redirected to, enter your phone number and choose to receive a code via SMS or phone call.

  3. Enter the 6-digit code you receive and click Verify.

You can now log in with just your username and password.

Important:
After logging in, you must re-enable your 2FA within 20 minutes. If you don't, you'll be logged out and will need to restart the reset process.

Authenticator App Warning:
Any old 2FA codes you may still have in your app will no longer work. You must set up 2FA again.

To re-enable 2FA, please follow the steps on this page:
https://ndax.io/en/support/login_and_multi_factor_authentication/setup-google-authenticator-2fa
